answers.answer: Bump, im in the same situation.

I had the same issue and had to have a c section. Heal.up time was minimal for me. Within two or three weeks I was up and about doing normal things with very little pain. I just kept active and didn't baby my situation. It helped. However the experience itself was awful bc I was having active panic attack during it but it differs for everyone lol

My first was vaginal. 2nd was emergency c section due to ruptured placenta. With vaginal delivery cramping, clotting and overall bleeding was intense. With the creation very little bleeding, no clotting (they completely clean you out) and no cramping. The Incision took about a year to stop hurting and to have actual feeling back. I am now expecting baby 3 and I think I am leaning towards another c section instead of a vbac.
Im in the same situation and due Friday. Doctor said she will induce me if he does not come by then. She doesn't want him getting to big and wants to avoid a c-section.
That's dumb. I had gd and I just gave birth toy son just fine. As long as you're keeping your sugars under control then its doubtful your baby will be too big.
My first was a csection due to his heart rate dropping to 20 during the induction. I didn't like it. My second was an unmedicated vbac. It was amazing. Both were big babies.

I have had 2 c sections and I am trying for a vba2c it hurts so much worse than natural bc I mean they cut you open and my dr makes you get up so many hours after you get filling back and it fills like the cut is going to rip open I actually passed out the 2nd time from the pain... I cried so much both times they told me I had to have a c section... & recovery is alot slower than natural birth..... my dr is going to try n let me have this baby#3 natural I just pray everything goes good and it happens

question: Because I have gestational diabetes my doctor has told me that there is a chance of me just going straight to a c-section if my little guy is too big. And as a first time mom, it honestly scares the poop out of me. I was just curious to know out of both ways to deliver, which did you like best? Which was easier to recover from? And what were your experiences like?
title: Moms who've experienced giving birth naturally and via c-section.
